com.google.android.vending.licensing
Class LicenseChecker

java.lang.Object
  com.google.android.vending.licensing.LicenseChecker
All Implemented Interfaces:
ServiceConnection
public class LicenseChecker
extends Object
implements ServiceConnection

Client library for Android Market license verifications.

The LicenseChecker is configured via a Policy which contains the logic to determine whether a user should have access to the application. For example, the Policy can define a threshold for allowable number of server or client failures before the library reports the user as not having access.

Must also provide the Base64-encoded RSA public key associated with your developer account. The public key is obtainable from the publisher site.

Method Detail

checkAccess

public void checkAccess(LicenseCheckerCallback callback)
Checks if the user should have access to the app. Binds the service if necessary.

NOTE: This call uses a trivially obfuscated string (base64-encoded). For best security, we recommend obfuscating the string that is passed into bindService using another method of your own devising.

source string: "com.android.vending.licensing.ILicensingService"

Parameters:
callback -

onDestroy

public void onDestroy()
Inform the library that the context is about to be destroyed, so that any open connections can be cleaned up.

Failure to call this method can result in a crash under certain circumstances, such as during screen rotation if an Activity requests the license check or when the user exits the application.
